snippet: Tour operators worry that recent changes to licensing rules could spell the end of an important cultural exchange between Americans and Cubans.
abstract: Process by which tour operators can renew 'people to people' licenses, allowing them to bring Americans without familial, scholarly or professional ties to Cuba, have become more complicated and slower; Obama administration loosened restrictions on travel to Cuba early in 2011, but 'people to people' ventures have faced criticism that they are thinly veiled tourist jaunts rather than intended educational exchange activities.
lead_paragraph: Tour operators worry that recent changes to licensing rules could spell the end of an important cultural exchange between Americans and Cubans.

headline.print_headline: Licensing Rules Slow Tours to Cuba
headline.seo: Licensing Rules Slow Tours to Cuba
headline.main: Licensing Rules Slow Tours to Cuba
